name: toxoplasma
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an organism that can cause an infection that can be dangerous for an unborn child if a pregnant woman is affected by it: There is a proven link between cats and toxoplasma dating back to 1970. Raw or undercooked meat can be a source of toxoplasma infection. See also
toxoplasmosis
More examplesFewer examplesThe virus is caused by the parasite toxoplasma.Meat must be uniformly heated to 66°C to kill intracystic toxoplasma. More than 75% of foodborne illness deaths are caused by just three pathogens: salmonella, listeria, and toxoplasma.
